oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Country Music Association Backstage Interviews - 1978-10-09
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Ralph Emery (entertainer) performing interviews for the Country Music Association Awards Show at the Grand Ole Opry. The recording takes place in the backstage of the awards. The recording took place on October 09, 1978.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Ralph Emery introduces Emmylou Harris who discuss Harris' waitressing career and Harris' album with Dolly Parton and Linda Ronstadt -- (01:51) Emery reveals that he believed Dom Williams would win an award -- (02:24) Joy Williams and Don Williams express their excitement for Don winning an award; additionally, Don reveals his sons are at home -- (03:04) Emery inquires as to how Larry Gatlin is feeling, and Don, Emery and Gatlin praise each other -- (04:22) Emery jokes about how Don Williams gave a speech -- (05:00) Emery performs a WHM radio spot -- (05:02) Dottie West praises Don, while Emery inquires about West recalling discussing her upcoming career with Kenny Rogers -- (05:57) Rogers expresses his excitement for winning the award, and Emery inquires about Roger's work with West -- (08:37) Emery reflects on the various personalities expressing their thanks -- (09:51) Emery and Ronnie McDowell reflect on each other's contribution to Country Music and McDowell's live album -- (12:46) Emery reflect on Kenny Roger's book joking about its helpfulness -- (13:25) Emery praises Grandpa Jones for receiving his entry to the Country Music Hall of Fame; additionally, Grandpa Jones how he got his stage name -- (16:19) Emery introduces the Female Vocalist of the Year: Crystal Gayle, and both discuss Gayle's upcoming Japanese tour -- (18:40) Emery discusses Dolly Parton's popularity, and Parton reflects on her dress -- (19:17) Parton and Emery reflect on Parton's Entertainer of the Year award, and Parton and Emery reflect on Parton's film career -- (21:29) Emery and Parton discuss Carl Dean's support of Parton's career -- (23:10) Emery reflects on trying to find the Oak Ridge Boys -- (24:00) Bill Golden reflects on being the senior member of the Oak Ridge Boys; additionally, Richard Sterban and Emery praise the Statler Brothers -- (27:38) Joe Bonsall, Emery, and Dwayne Allen reflect on the speech the Oak Ridge Boys gave after winning their award -- (29:33) Bonsall reflects on the Oak Ridge Boys' excitement when it came to gospel music and their change to country -- (32:50) Emery reflects on the variety of award winners -- (34:10) Emery intervenes on an interview Roy Clark; additionally, both joke about Clark's weight in high school -- (36:00) Emery and Clark reflect on the pride Tulsa, Oklahoma has in Clark; additionally, Clark recalls getting fired by Jimmy Dean -- (37:37) Emery reflects on Parton's popularity while discussing the remaining award winners; additionally, Emery says goodnight -- (39:17) Eight More Miles to Louisville [incomplete] (Grandpa Jones)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Parton, Dolly; Harris, Emmylou; Gatlin, Larry; Gatlin, Larry, 1948-; Rogers, Kenny; McDowell, Ronnie; Grandpa Jones; Grandpa Jones, 1913-1998; Gayle, Crystal; Oak Ridge Boys; Clark, Roy; Clark, Roy, 1933-; Williams, Don, 1939-; Williams, Don, 1939-2017; West, Dottie, 1932-1991;
